TECHNICAL_SECTION.FORM_LG_LIST: DA DE EN ES FI FR EL IT NL PT SV CS ET HU LT LV MT PL SK SL GA BG RO HR

CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice without call for competition
CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Investment Bank, European Investment Fund, European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: BR101

ML_TI_DOC.TI_TEXT: EBGU - Projektet for den paneuropæiske korridor
EBWE - Projekt zu den paneuropäischen Verkehrskorridoren
ERPB - Visos Europos transporto koridorių projektas
EBOR - Projekt týkajúci sa paneurópskych koridorov

TI_DOC.P: EBGU - Projektet for den paneuropæiske korridor (UA-Kyiv)

CONTENTS.P: Project name: Pan-European Corridors Project
Country: Ukraine
Business sector: Transport
Project ID: 8932-GPN-40185
Funding source: EBRD, EIB
Type of contract: Project goods, works and services
Type of notice: General procurement notice
Issue date: 17.1.2018
Closing date: 17.1.2019 at 23:59 (local time)
This notice is an update to the general procurement notice for this project which was originally published in procurement opportunities on 7.7.2014 and updated on 1 December 2016.

The State Road Agency of Ukraine (Ukravtodor) has received the loans from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development and European Investment Bank (Banks) towards the cost of the Pan-European Corridors project and intends to use the proceeds of loans for procurement of the following remaining contracts:
— Repair of the section of M01 Kyiv – Chernigiv - Novy Yarylovychi Road (km18+730 – km 98 + 800),
— Construction of traffic interchanges on M05 Kyiv – Odessa Road: km 15+390; km 21+847 and M06 Kyiv – Chop Road: km 21+767; km 15 + 668; km 20 + 029,

— Construction of separate-grade traffic interchanges on M01 Kyiv – Chernigiv - Novy Yarylovychi Road (km 23+150; km 27 + 580; km 36 + 482; km 40 + 330; km 83 + 200), as well as pedestrian bridges on M06 Kyiv – Chop Road.
Tendering process for construction works to be launched in the first and third quarter of 2018.

Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from Banks will be subject to the Banks’ Procurement Policies and Rules and will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Banks’ loans will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, or for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the purchaser’s country.
Interested contractors should contact:

Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from Banks will be subject to the Banks’ Procurement Policies and Rules and will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Banks’ loans will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, or for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the purchaser’s country.

The proceeds of the Banks’ loans will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, or for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the purchaser’s country.
Interested contractors should contact:
